intro: Pedicularis heterophylla, commonly known as the yellow monkey orchid, is a member of the Orobanchaceae family and is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. This perennial herbaceous plant is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, often in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a unique structure with a long, slender stem and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by bees and other insects, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
